column1: Yahaya Bello Did NOT Test Positive with COVID-19

column4: There are no reports by the Nigerian Centre for Disease Control to corroborate the claim. Not to mention, Yahaya Bello, himself released a video debunking the claim. Moreover, the report format lacks credibility with no discernable details or source present.

column4: No Nigerian senator has tested positive for coronavirus, not according to the NCDC or any credible news platform. The Nigerian Centre for Disease Control remains the number one source on all updates to confirmed Covid-19 cases in the country.

column1: Viral posts sharing symptoms and treatments for Covid-19 contain false information
column3: Covid-19 starts with a sore throat lasting 3-4 days. It then blends into a nasal fluid that enters the trachea and the lungs, causing pneumonia, which takes about 5 or 6 days. With pneumonia comes high fever and difficulty breathing. The nasal congestion makes you feel like you’...
column4: This is a roughly accurate description of the most common symptoms, although not everyone with Covid-19 gets pneumonia. The symptoms may not come in this order or at these times. There have been no reports of sufferers experiencing nasal congestion that makes them feel they are drowning.

column1: View article
column3: Three Maryland coronavirus patients fully recovered and are able to return to everyday life.
column4: Correct. On 13 March 2020, Montgomery County, Maryland confirmed that three residents who previously had the virus no longer tested positive.

column1: View article
column3: The number of new cases in South Korea is declining.
column4: This was correct when the viral post began to appear. Reported new cases declined from their peak in late February, and have been roughly level since mid-March

column1: View article
column3: Apple has reopened all 42 China stores.
column4: Correct. On 13 March 2020, Apple announced that it had reopened all 42 stores in mainland China after a closure of almost six weeks.

column1: View article
column3: Doctors in India have been successful in treating coronavirus with a combination of drugs (Lopinavir, Retonovir, Oseltamivir along with Chlorphenamine) and are going to suggest the same medicine globally.
column4: India’s ministry of health has advised that the anti-HIV drugs, Lopinavir and Retonovir, are used in some groups of Covid-19 patients. But it is unclear how successful this treatment has been. The other two drugs from the claim are not mentioned in their guidance.

column1: View article
column3: Researchers at the Erasmus Medical Center claim to have found an antibody against coronavirus.
column4: Researchers in the Netherlands have released research, which has not yet been peer-reviewed, on an antibody against the new coronavirus.

column1: View article
column3: China has closed down its last coronavirus hospital. Not enough new cases to support them.
column4: This is correct. The last hospitals closed at the start of March 2020.

column1: View article
column3: A 103 year-old Chinese grandmother has made a full recovery from Covid-19 after being treated for 6 days in Wuhan, China
column4: This has been widely reported in the media.

column1: View article
column3: Italy is hit hard, experts say, only because they have the oldest population in Europe.
column4: Whilst it is true that an older population has contributed to a high number of deaths in Italy, it may not be the sole reason.

column1: View article
column3: Scientists in Israel are likely to announce the development of a coronavirus vaccine.
column4: Scientists in Israel and elsewhere are working on developing a vaccination to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus, but it won’t be ready for the public for over a year.

column1: View article
column3: Tulsa County's first positive Covid-19 case has recovered. This individual has had two negative tests, which is the indicator of recovery.
column4: Correct, this patient has recovered according to official Tulsa County sources. Two negative tests is one of three official indicators of recovery among people with Covid-19 (who showed symptoms).

column1: View article
column3: The number of new cases in South Korea is declining.
column4: This was correct when the viral post began to appear. Reported new cases declined from their peak in late February, and have been roughly level since mid-March

column1: View article
column3: Apple has reopened all 42 China stores.
column4: Correct. On 13 March 2020, Apple announced that it had reopened all 42 stores in mainland China after a closure of almost six weeks.

column1: View article
column3: Three Maryland coronavirus patients fully recovered and are able to return to everyday life.
column4: Correct. On 13 March 2020, Montgomery County, Maryland confirmed that three residents who previously had the virus no longer tested positive.

column1: View article
column3: Plasma from newly recovered patients from Covid -19 can treat others infected by Covid-19.
column4: This is being used as a treatment in some countries, but clinical trials have not yet proved that this is effective.

column1: View article
column3: A network of Canadian scientists are making excellent progress in Covid-19 research.
column4: At least one group of Canadian scientists has recently announced some progress in understanding Covid-19.

column1: View article
column3: Cleveland Clinic developed a Covid-19 test that gives results in hours, not days.
column4: This is incorrect. The clinic announced that it is able to speed up Covid-19 testing after developing the ability to test on-site, but it had not developed a new test.

column1: View article
column3: A San Diego biotech company is developing a Covid-19 vaccine in collaboration with Duke University and National University of Singapore.
column4: This is correct. The company, Arcturus Therapeutics, announced on 4 March 2020 that it would be working on a vaccine with DukeNUS Medical School in Singapore.

column1: There’s limited data on how many Covid-19 tests are being done globally, but the UK doesn’t rank third in the world
column3: UK is testing more people for Covid-19 than any country other than China and Italy.
column4: This is incorrect. As at 13 March, the latest data available when this claim was made, the UK ranked fifth (behind China, South Korea, Italy and Russia) for the number of Covid-19 tests carried out. These statistics only included the 38 countries and regions with official data on Covid-19 tests at that time.
